page.syntax: Token_Found as C = ScanTypedToken as C([kind as c])

argument.name: Token_Found
argument.description: A new scanner object that supports operations against Text.

argument.name: kind
argument.description: Optional. Default = next token found. The type of the next token to find. See &ltStringScanner>.ScanToToken() for token types.

page.description: Return next token in form of [<Kind>:<Token>].
page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.ScanTypedToken() function returns the next Token_Found in the format Kind : Token.
page.example: dim t as C t = <<%txt% result[1] = foo( x + y , "Some text" ) .or. (lookfor = .F.) .or. ( date()= {10/10/2005} complex[1].subelement[1].property %txt% scanner = stringscanner.create(t) ? scanner.scanover(5) = "[1] =" ? scanner.ScanTypedToken() = "F: foo"
